results.title: Why innovate?
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Innovations”.
A three film series useful in illustrating to teachers the nature and benefits of innovations in the school. Parents and teachers express views concerning education. One example shows children’s work displayed in a local pub.

results.title: Why I.T.?
results.creator_credit: Stewart Films, Great Britain. Royal Navy and Dick Need
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Instructional Techniques”.
Demonstrates the need for adequate training in the complex technological environment of a large undertaking like the Royal Navy, and discusses the standard of instruction necessary.

results.title: Why I sing: the words and music of Gilles Vigneault
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Ian McLaren and John Howe
results.brief_description: Le troubadour de Natashquan, singer, songwriter, one-man show - Gilles Vigneault is one of the most popular entertainers in French Canada. He sweeps the audience along with his irrepressible exuberance, every so often breaking into a little jig around the microphone. In this film you get to know him even more intimately than does his theatre audience. His serious side emerges when he speaks of the themes of his songs (the internationally popular Mon Pays is one of these).

results.title: Why grow fat hogs?
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Deptartment of Agriculture and Julian Biggs
results.brief_description: A film encouraging farmers to grow lean bacon-type market pigs. Demonstrates different cuts of meat showing the variety of levels of fat. The economic and health benefits are described.

results.title: Why fluoridation?
results.creator_credit: American Dental Association, Vision Associates and Lee R. Bobker
results.brief_description: Presents only positive aspects of adding fluoride to the community water supply. Discusses fluoridation and its effectiveness, and explains why fluoridation of water supply is preferable to topical application of fluoride to the teeth or the adding of fluoride to milk.
results.creator_credit_for_label: American Dental Association, Vision Associates and Lee R. Bobker

results.title: Why explore space?
results.brief_description: A thought-provoking film that raises questions in both science and social studies. What are the values of space research? How does it relate to world problems? How will new knowledge change your life? The theme is brought to life through a superbly documented historic event: the flight of John Glenn, first American to circle the Earth in space.

results.title: Why exercise?
results.creator_credit: Associated Film Services and Jan Sadlo
results.brief_description: Illustrates the values of muscular activity, emphasizing the fact that the human body makes adaptations to the exercise demands place upon it and these adaptations are in the form of increased strength, greater endurance, and improved flexibility.

results.title: Why Eros?
results.brief_description: The Shaftesbury Society has a number of schools and hostels in Britain to look after mainly physically handicapped people. The film concentrates on children with muscular dystrophy and spina bifida and shows them at various activities.

results.title: Why drown?
results.brief_description: Demonstrates “drown-proofing” developed by Fred Lanoue by showing how to survive for long periods in water in an emergency. Shows how to discard and use clothing, time breathing and reduce fatigue in detail. Features Lloyd Bridges and Murray Rose.

results.title: Why does the moon wear no clothes?
results.brief_description: A quirky animated film concerning an old tailor whose efforts to make a suit of clothing for the moon are confounded by the moon’s changing shape.
